Detailed Description

Interface definition for a callback to be invoked when the checked radio button changed in this group.

We can use RadioGroup::setOnCheckedChangeListener to register this callback.

The following example demonstrates how to use the IRadioGroupCheckedChangeListener

 RadioGroupTest.h
 class MyCheckedChangeListener: public gaia::ui::IRadioGroupCheckedChangeListener
 {
   public:
     MyCheckedChangeListener(gaia::core::Page* page);
     virtual ~MyCheckedChangeListener();
     virtual void onCheckedChanged(gaia::ui::RadioGroup* group, int32_t checkedId);
 };

 RadioGroupTest.cpp
 MyCheckedChangeListener::MyCheckedChangeListener(gaia::core::Page* page)
   : IRadioGroupCheckedChangeListener()
 {
 }

 MyCheckedChangeListener::~MyCheckedChangeListener()
 {
 }

 void MyCheckedChangeListener::onCheckedChanged(gaia::ui::RadioGroup* group, int32_t checkedId)
 {
    //Called when the checked radio button has changed.
 }

 void RadioGroupTest::onInit(Persistence* const p) {
    // create a Radio Group
    gaia::ui::RadioGroup* mpRadioGroup = new gaia::ui::RadioGroup(static_cast<Page*>(this));

    //create a Radio Button
    gaia::ui::RadioButton* mpRadioButton = new gaia::ui::RadioButton(static_cast<Page*>(this));

    // set RadioButton text
    mpRadioButton->setText("Hello");

    // create a RadioGroupLayoutParams
    gaia::ui::RadioGroupLayoutParams* mpRadioGroupLayoutParams = new gaia::ui::RadioGroupLayoutParams(
             ControllerParams::WRAP_CONTENT, ControllerParams::WRAP_CONTENT);

    // add RadioButton to RadioGroup
    mpRadioGroup->addWidget(mpRadioButton, 0, mpRadioGroupLayoutParams);

    // Initialize IRadioGroupCheckedChangeListener and add it into the RadioGroup
    MyCheckedChangeListener* mpListener = new MyCheckedChangeListener(static_cast<Page*>(this));
    mpRadioGroup->setOnCheckedChangeListener(mpListener);
 }
